title: Fighting Rages in Gaza and Lebanon, Despite Killing of Hamas Leader
content: Peace talks were nowhere in sight and violence seemed only to increase, as Israel struck northern Gaza and a drone from Lebanon hit near the Israeli prime minister’s home.
summary: Peace talks were nowhere in sight and violence seemed only to increase, as Israel struck northern Gaza and a drone from Lebanon hit near the Israeli prime minister’s home.

title: Cuba Suffers Second Power Outage in 24 Hours, Realizing Years of Warnings
content: Fidel Castro once called Cuba’s power plants “prehistoric.” But the country still relies on them, contributing to the longest blackout since the collapse of its former patron, the Soviet Union.
summary: Fidel Castro once called Cuba’s power plants “prehistoric.” But the country still relies on them, contributing to the longest blackout since the collapse of its former patron, the Soviet Union.

title: Tensions Spike in Mozambique After Killing of 2 Political Activists
content: Leading supporters of the top opposition presidential candidate, Venâncio Mondlane, were fatally shot in their car following an election marred by allegations of fraud.
summary: Leading supporters of the top opposition presidential candidate, Venâncio Mondlane, were fatally shot in their car following an election marred by allegations of fraud.

title: Despite Sinwar’s Death, Mideast Peace May Still Be Elusive
content: Just about all of the actors in the region are looking for an “offramp” to the conflict, many analysts say. But Hezbollah and Hamas are talking tough, and Israel is not backing down.
summary: Just about all of the actors in the region are looking for an “offramp” to the conflict, many analysts say. But Hezbollah and Hamas are talking tough, and Israel is not backing down.

title: Despite Israeli Bombs and Assassinations, Hezbollah Keeps Fighting
content: Extensive Israeli attacks have blown up Hezbollah munitions and killed many fighters and leaders, but the Lebanese militia is far from incapacitated, analysts say.
summary: Extensive Israeli attacks have blown up Hezbollah munitions and killed many fighters and leaders, but the Lebanese militia is far from incapacitated, analysts say.

title: 5 Provisions in China’s Panda Contracts With U.S. Zoos
content: Normally confidential contracts show that U.S. zoos are accepting increasingly strict terms governing panda cams and public statements.

title: A Soldier Chose a Radical Way to Publicize Troop Fatigue: He Deserted
content: Serhii Hnezdilov, a Ukrainian soldier, said he wanted to draw attention to the need to discharge worn-out soldiers and replace them with fresh conscripts.
summary: Serhii Hnezdilov, a Ukrainian soldier, said he wanted to draw attention to the need to discharge worn-out soldiers and replace them with fresh conscripts.

title: How Moldova’s Most Popular T.V. Host Torched Her Career With a Startling Life Choice
content: Natalia Morari once reported on corrupt business in Moldova. Now she has upset many by having a son with a tycoon accused of corruption, and running against the pro-West president in elections.
summary: Natalia Morari once reported on corrupt business in Moldova. Now she has upset many by having a son with a tycoon accused of corruption, and running against the pro-West president in elections.

title: Israel Steps Up Attacks Near Beirut, Despite U.S. Warnings
content: Israel carried out a series of strikes near the Lebanese capital on Saturday, killing two people fleeing a vehicle on a busy highway. Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin warned Israel to scale back attacks near Beirut.
summary: Israel carried out a series of strikes near the Lebanese capital on Saturday, killing two people fleeing a vehicle on a busy highway. Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin warned Israel to scale back attacks near Beirut.

title: Sinwar’s Final Moments: On the Run, Hurt, Alone, but Still Defiant

title: An Alarming Glimpse Into a Future of Historic Droughts
content: Record dry conditions in South America have led to wildfires, power cuts and water rationing. The world’s largest river system, the Amazon, which sustains some 30 million people across eight countries, is drying up.
summary: Record dry conditions in South America have led to wildfires, power cuts and water rationing. The world’s largest river system, the Amazon, which sustains some 30 million people across eight countries, is drying up.

title: The Gisele Pelicot Rape Trial Hits Painfully Close to Home in This French Town

title: U.N. Peacekeeping Force in Southern Lebanon Will Remain, U.N. Official Says

title: What Yahya Sinwar’s Death Could Mean for the Gaza Cease-Fire Talks
